＊RESULTS AND DISCUSSIONWe?rst employed a fragment coupling approach by takingadvantages of the three progressive and controllable reactionsites of cyanuric chloride.20Reaction of ( S)-binaphthol (( S)-1)with 2.5 equiv of cyanuric chloride ( 2) in THF at 0 ＜C withdiisopropylethylamine (DIPEA) as an acid scavenger a ?ordedthe trimer ( S)-3in an 89% yield ( Scheme 1 ). Macrocyclizationbetween equimolar amounts of ( S)-3and ( S)-binaphthol wentsmoothly in acetone at rt and gave the desired product of(S,S)-Min a 52% yield, which was better than that of areported protocol35(33% yield, acetonitrile as solvent). Thefurther reaction of the macrocycle with another equivalent of(S)-binaphthol in acetonitrile via heating at re ?ux for 12 h inthe presence of K2CO3a?orded ( S,S,S)-Cage in a high yield of85%.

With the success of the fragment coupling approach, wewondered if a direct one-pot approach would work. To ourdelight both the macrocycle and the cage could be readilyobtained in even higher yields by just mixing ( S)-binaphtholand cyanuric chloride in a given ratio ( Scheme 2 ). Thereaction of a 1:1 mixture in DIPEA/acetone at rt for 4 da?orded the macrocycle in a 42% yield. The yield was furtherimproved to 63% under K2CO 3/CH 3CN conditions within ashorter time (12 h) ( Scheme 2 a). Alternatively, the reaction ofa 3:2 mixture under K 2CO 3/CH 3CN conditions via heating atre?ux for 12 h a ?orded the cage in a 91% yield ( Scheme 2 b)!The simple operation and high e ?ciency allow multigram-scalemacrocycle and cage products to be a ?orded very easily. Theenantiomers, namely ( R,R)-Mand ( R,R,R)-Cage ,w e r esimilarly synthesized from ( R)-binaphthol. All the productsare essentially enantiopure (>99% ee) as determined by chiralHPLC (see the Supporting Information ).

Chem. 2022, 87, 3491 ?34973494of (S)-1(5.73 g, 20.0 mmol) and diisopropylethylamine (DIPEA)(6.46 g, 50.0 mmol) in THF (100 mL). The resulting mixture wasstirred at 0 ＜C for another 12 h. The solvent was evaporated underreduced pressure, and the residue was subjected to columnchromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate = 5:1)to give ( S)-3as a pale yellow solid in an 89% yield (11.3 g).

(S,S)-M.35At room temperature, solutions of ( S)-3(583 mg, 1.0mmol) in acetone (50 mL) and ( S)-1(287 mg, 1.0 mmol) in acetone(50 mL) were added dropwise at the same time and the same rate to asolution of diisopropylethylamine (DIPEA) (388 mg, 3.0 mmol) inacetone (100 mL) over 2 h. After addition, the resulting mixture wasstirred at room temperature for another 3 d. The solvent wasevaporated under reduced pressure, and the residue was subjected tocolumn chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/dichloro-methane = 1:1) to give ( S,S)-Mas a white solid in a 53% yield (416mg). One-Pot Synthesis of Homochiral Macrocycle and Cage(Scheme 2 ).(S,S)-M.A mixture of ( S)-1(573 mg, 2.0 mmol), 2(369mg, 2.0 mmol), and K 2CO 3(828 mg, 6.0 mmol) was stirred in MeCN(200 mL, dried by 4 ? molecular sieves) at room temperature for 12h. The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and theresidue was subjected to column chromatography on silica gel(petroleum ether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,S)-Mas a whitesolid in a 63% yield (500 mg).

Gram-Scale Preparation. A mixture of ( S)-1(2.87 g, 10.0 mmol),2(1.85 g, 10.0 mmol), and K2CO3(4.14 g, 30.0 mmol) was stirred inMeCN (50 mL, dried by 4 ? molecular sieves) at room temperaturefor 4 d. The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and theresidue was subjected to column chromatography on silica gel(petroleum ether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,S)-Mas a whitesolid in a 56% yield (3.92 g).

Found: C, 69.43; H,3.05; N, 10.55. (S,S,S)- Cage .A mixture of ( S)-1(859 mg, 3.0 mmol), 2(369 mg,2.0 mmol), and K2CO3(1.24 g, 9.0 mmol) in MeCN (200 mL, driedby 4 ? molecular sieves) was heated at re ?ux in an oil bath for 12 h.

The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and the residuewas subjected to column chromatography on silica gel (petroleumether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,S,S)-Cage as a white solid ina 91% yield (916 mg).

Gram-Scale Preparation. A mixture of ( S)-1(4.30 g, 15.0 mmol),2(1.85 g, 10.0 mmol), and K2CO3(6.21 g, 45.0 mmol) in MeCN (1L, dried by 4 ? molecular sieves) was heated at re ?ux in an oil bathfor 12 h. The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and theresidue was subjected to column chromatography on silica gel(petroleum ether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,S,S)-Cage as awhite solid in an 87% yield (4.4 g).
(R,R,R)- Cage .Synthesized in the same way as described above from(R)-1in a 97% yield. The characterization data are consistent. Anal.

Synthesis of the Heterochiral Macrocycle and Cage(Scheme 3 ).(S,R)-M.At room temperature, solutions of ( S)-3(583 mg, 1.0 mmol) in acetone (50 mL) and ( R)-1(287 mg, 1.0mmol) in acetone (50 mL) were added dropwise at the same timeand the same rate to a solution of diisopropylethylamine (DIPEA)(312 mg, 2.4 mmol) in acetone (150 mL) over 2 h. After addition, theresulting mixture was stirred at room temperature for another 20 h.

The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and the residuewas subjected to column chromatography on silica gel (petroleumether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,R)-Mas a white solid in an83% yield (657 mg). Gram-Scale Preparation. At room temperature, solutions of ( S)-3(5.83 g, 10.0 mmol) in acetone (250 mL) and ( R)-1(2.87 g, 10.0mmol) in acetone (250 mL) were added dropwise at the same timeand the same rate to a solution of diisopropylethylamine (DIPEA)(3.12 g, 24.0 mmol) in acetone (1.50 L) over 3 h. After addition, theresulting mixture was stirred at room temperature for another 2 d.The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure, and the residuewas subjected to column chromatography on silica gel (petroleumether/dichloromethane = 1:1) to give ( S,R)-Mas a white solid in an89% yield (7.04 g).

Crystallographic data  The single crystal s of (S,S)-M?THF , (S,R)-M?CH 2Cl2 and (S,S,S )-Cage ?3CH 2Cl2 were cultivated by slow diffusion  of ethyl ether to a sample solution  in THF, CH 2Cl2, CH 2Cl2 at room  temperature  respectively . The single crystal of  rac-hetero -chiral cage  ((S,S,R )-Cage  + (R,R,S )-Cage ) was cultivated by slow diffusion  of n-hexane  to a racemic sample  solution in Cl2CHCHCl 2 at room  temperature.
